intro: Allanblackia kimbiliensis, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a tropical plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a fruit that contains a valuable nut, similar to shea butter, used in cosmetics and food products. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Allanblackia kimbiliensis is also noted for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
